paper.title: Probabilistic Quantifiers, Adversaries, and Complexity Classes: An Overview
paper.venue: Structure in Complexity Theory Annual Conference
paper.abstract: We consider inclusion relations among a multitude of classical complexity classes and classes with probabilistic components. A key tool is a method for characterizing such classes in terms of the ordinary quantifiers ∃ and ∀ together with a quantifier ∃+, which means roughly “for most”, applied to polynomial-time predicates. This approach yields a uniform treatment which leads to easier proofs for class-inclusion and hierarchy-collapse results. Furthermore the method captures some recently introduced game classes and game hierarchies.
